verbs.description: refunction (third-person singular simple present refunctions, present participle refunctioning, simple past and past participle refunctioned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To transform (a culture or institution, etc.) in order to promote social change.
examples: A global corporate power, Del Rio Inc., attempts to refunction a Mexican peasant culture of small-holders for biopolitical exploitation by commodifying the water that sustains their way of life.
